authors: Wikimedia Core Platform & Trust and Safety teams

mediamoderation-email-body-intro:
{{notranslate}} The text that is at the start of the email sent when a SHA-1 matches PhotoDNA.

Parameters:
* $1 - How many images are present in the email (used for GENDER support).
* $2 - The name of the wiki the images were found.
mediamoderation-email-body-file-line:
{{notranslate}} Used as a bullet point item in the email to detail a match on a given file.

Parameters:
* $1 - The name of the file on-wiki which may be wrapped in a link.
* $2 - A localised list containing the upload timestamps for the files that matched. These upload timestamps may be individually wrapped in a link.
mediamoderation-email-body-file-revision:
{{notranslate}} Used as a item in a list of upload timestamps for files which was a match according to PhotoDNA.

Parameters:
* $1 - The upload timestamp in a human readable format
* $2 - The URL to the file revision.
mediamoderation-email-body-files-missing: {{notranslate}} Text added to the bottom of the email sent when a SHA-1 matches to indicate what filenames had file versions that matched but also had no upload timestamp.
mediamoderation-email-subject:
{{notranslate}} The subject for the email sent when a SHA-1 matches PhotoDNA.

Parameters:
* $1 - The SHA-1 that was a match.
* $2 - The time that the email was sent for de-duplication of the subject line.
